metadata.title: CVE-2021-35473 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in LemonLDAP::NG before 2.0.12. There is a missingexpiration check in the OAuth2.0 handler, i.e., it does not verify accesstoken validity. An attacker can use a expired access token from an OIDCclient to access the OAuth2 handler The earliest affected version is 2.0.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemonldap-ng - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-fastcgi-server - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-handler - 2.0.11+ds-4
lemonldap-ng-uwsgi-app - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-common-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-handler-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-manager-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-portal-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
liblemonldap-ng-ssoaas-apache-client-perl - 2.0.11+ds-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lemonldap-ng package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.11+ds-4').
